intro: Ostrya virginiana subsp. virginiana, commonly known as the American hornbeam, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and smooth, gray bark. The tree produces small, yellowish-green catkins in early spring, followed by winged samaras in the fall. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of 10 to 30 meters. This subspecies is often found in mixed hardwood forests and is valued for its ornamental and ecological benefits.
